title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020), and having consulted with the Minister for Justice
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) 

Act 2020 (Closure Day) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited central mental hospital (relocation) act 2020 (closure day) order 2022

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020), and having consulted with the Minister for Justice
heading: 2. The 1st day of January 2023 is appointed as the closure day for the
text_raw:
2. The 1st day of January 2023 is appointed as the closure day for the 
purposes of the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) Act 2020 (No. 28 of 
2020). 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 December, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [672] 3
text_norm: 2 1st day january 2023 appointed closure day purpose central mental hospital (relocation) act 2020 (no 28 2020) given official seal 15 december 2022 stephen donnelly minister health notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 20th december 2022 672 3

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020), and having consulted with the Minister for Justice
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints the 1st January 2023 as the day on which the former 
Central Mental Hospital in Dundrum will cease to operate, as provided for in 
section 4(1) of the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) Act 2020. The Act 
provides for the relocation of the Central Mental Hospital from its former 
location in Dundrum to its current location in Portrane, which occurred on 13th 
November 2022, for the transfer of persons lawfully detained in Dundrum to 
Portrane, which also occurred on 13th November 2022, for the closure of the 
Dundrum facility, and for the repeal of section 39 of the Mental Treatment Act
text_norm: explanatory note (this note part instrument purport legal interpretation.) order appoints 1st january 2023 day former central mental hospital dundrum cease operate provided section 4(1) central mental hospital (relocation) act 2020 act provides relocation central mental hospital former location dundrum current location portrane occurred 13th november 2022 transfer person lawfully detained dundrum portrane also occurred 13th november 2022 closure dundrum facility repeal section 39 mental treatment act
